      "source": [
        "# Quantum Energy Levels of Hydrogen\n",
        "\n",
        "This notebook visualizes the energy levels of the hydrogen atom and possible electron transitions."

      ],
      "source": [
        "\n",
        "import numpy as np\n",
        "import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n",
        "import ipywidgets as widgets\n",
        "\n",
        "# Constants\n",
        "Rydberg = 13.6  # eV\n",
        "\n",
        "def plot_energy(max_n=5):\n",
        "    plt.figure(figsize=(8,6))\n",
        "\n",
        "    # Draw energy levels\n",
        "    for n in range(1, max_n+1):\n",
        "        E = -Rydberg / (n**2)\n",
        "        plt.hlines(E, xmin=0, xmax=1, colors='blue')\n",
        "        plt.text(1.05, E, f\"n={n}, E={E:.2f} eV\", verticalalignment='center')\n",
        "\n",
        "    # Example transitions\n",
        "    plt.title(\"Hydrogen Atom Energy Levels\")\n",
        "    plt.ylabel(\"Energy (eV)\")\n",
        "    plt.xticks([])\n",
        "    plt.ylim(-Rydberg-1, 0)\n",
        "    plt.show()\n",
        "\n",
        "widgets.interact(plot_energy, max_n=widgets.IntSlider(value=5, min=2, max=10, step=1))"
      ]
    }
